column3: str

Hamlyn is quivering in his excitement.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

It turns out that Hamlyn's master plan to restore peace to the plundered caravan is strikingly similar─if not utterly identical─to the plan you carried out not moments ago. If it will solve your sylph dilemma long enough to get your hands on some glorious eggs, however, you're willing to give it the old Archon try. You head to the Central Shroud and prepare to combat the sylphs' green mood with some green of your own.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.
※The FATE “Don't Be Sylphish” can only be completed as a Disciple of War or Magic.

After a frantic scuffle involving sylphs, a giant mammet, and more tonberries than is comfortable to have in one location, you manage to recover the scattered Archon eggs. Panting from exertion and pleased to be free of your sweaty guise (once more pawed off you by an overzealous Hamlyn), you trek back to Gridania to give Jihli the good news.

Hamlyn is singing your praises─or, more accurately, the noble tonberry's praises─with phlegmy excitement when you arrive, lamenting only the absence of large crowds who might have witnessed the miraculous feats performed by his adorable idols. As it turns out, enough townsfolk were present to warrant extending personal thanks for returning their precious eggs─which they ought to decorate <Emphasis>as</Emphasis> tonberries to prevent any further sylph shenanigans, Hamlyn helpfully suggests. While Hamlyn could not be less subtle in his tonberry touting, you can't deny the modicum of truth in his suggestion, and really, you'd just like to get on with it already. Jihli smiles and officially proclaims the start of Hatching–tide─let the eggy, eggy, stabby fun begin!
Complete the FATE “Don't Be Sylphish” in the Central Shroud.
Report to Jihli Aliapoh
I beg you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─speak with Hamlyn and see how we might recover those Archon eggs!
All those eggs... All those beautifully decorated─and <Emphasis>expensive</Emphasis>─eggs...

You wish to lend your strength to my brilliant plan, do you? <snort> Very well. Our divine mission is as follows─we must adorn ourselves in the guise of the tonberry, and scare the sylphs away from the fallen eggs!

...Ahem, it may seem like a rather familiar tactic, but terror is not so easily overcome. And neither is the power of tonberry! <snort> No, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>fine sir</If>─we shall remind those sylphs of what adorable horror lurks in the shadow.
We shall take the tonberry's naturally winsome and captivating visage and transform it into an image of pure evil.
Observe!
I suppose that makes sense. But what of the delivery mammet? In its panicked state, it may easily mistake us for naught but common egg-thieves─er, perhaps not so common, considering the guises.
That's where <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>'s participation is crucial. <snort> Even an overexcited automaton is no match for an adventurer versed in the arts of warfare!
Of course, I shan't be so cruel as to send you into battle as defenseless as swaddled tonberry.

You may rely upon me to perform the necessary <shlorp> <Emphasis>enhancements</Emphasis> upon your guise, that shall grant any sweetheart of darkness the strength to withstand the harshest of electrified zaps! ...For the most part, anyway.
Heeeeee! In the midst of adversity lies opportunity, as they say─or in our case, in the midst of scattered Archon eggs stands the triumphant tonberry, that all might witness its infallible glory!
Very well. Let us proceed with Hamlyn's plan and see that our eggs are recovered safely!

Hmhmhm, excellent! <snort> I shall commence the <Emphasis>enhancement</Emphasis> of this guise at once and have it ready for deployment in two flicks of a tonberry's blade!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─let us meet where the bells of destiny toll. To arms!
I will contact the Adventurers' Guild to see if any there are willing to help!
You'll find the caravan by the Mirror Planks in the Central Shroud. You can't miss it─not even if you tried...
You did it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You truly did it!
Incredible! Exquisite! Sheer majesty, the likes of which I have never seen! <heavy breathing>

And here comes our hero now!
Hamlyn has just been regaling me with tales of your success, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
We can't thank you enough for recovering those Archon eggs! Truly and sincerely─from the bottom of our hearts and purses─thank you!
My singular regret is that no rapturous bystanders were present in those solitary woods to witness such valorous displays of the tonberry!

Alas, its majesty will once again pass unacknowledged. <snort>
Yet, such is often the way with true excellence! Yes, the hero that works in secrecy for the betterment of all─<Emphasis>this</Emphasis> is the true nature of tonberry.

(-Nonotta-)I'll, er, take your word for it!
I must say, Hamlyn, your ability to find fascination in the most unlikely places is both remarkable and admirable...
(-???-)Erm, pardon me!

<Emphasis>We</Emphasis> were in the solitary woods! And we saw what you did for us.
...Er, what the <Emphasis>tonberries</Emphasis> did for us.
I was heartbroken when a sylph snatched the Archon egg that my dear friend had given me...
...But thanks to you and all the other tonberry volunteers, it was recovered safely!
I wonder, though─is there no other way to deter the sylphs' mischief? I couldn't help but feel sorry for them, fleeing as they did in such a fright...
What will you say?
Sounds like a job for sylph-repellant.
My tonberry senses are tingling...
Of course! <snort> If we decorate our eggs in the theme of tonberry, the sylphs wouldn't dare snatch or sabotage them!
Hmm... A dark green coat on a large egg...with two small golden ones for eyes? Not bad at all! Perhaps even cute, if you don't think too hard about it!
Jihli, perhaps <Emphasis>this</Emphasis> is what your dream foretold! Not simply the volunteers in tonberry guises, but the tonberry eggs and decorations as well!
In which case, we should send word to our Ul'dahn goldsmiths that we'd like another batch of Archon eggs in some striking shades of tonberry.

Of course, all our eggs are packaged during transit, meaning the sylphs will likely continue their mischief until we can unwrap them safely. I'm tempted to send a tonberry guard along with the caravan, but the road from Ul'dah is far too long a journey to attempt in such a guise...
We shall continue to consider possible alternatives, but in the meantime, if you happen to come across another waylaid shipment, I hope I can count on your assistance? Er...as a tonberry, of course.
Well, as our Archon eggs have finally arrived, I daresay it is time to officially get <Emphasis>cracking</Emphasis>! Let the Hatching–tide festivities begin!
You have unlocked the Egg Hunter Riggy mini-game. To play mini-games, open the toy chest found in any inn room.
